intro: Austrobaileya, commonly known as the New Zealand daisy or the flame tree, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. Austrobaileya is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to a variety of soil types. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
